movie_title: This Video Might Save 58 Lives Next Week
introduction: Go to https://brilliant.org/nutshell/ to dive deeper into these topics and more with a free 30-day t

vocabulary.definition: able to be avoided or prevented
vocabulary.example: By following safety precautions, many accidents are avoidable.

vocabulary.definition: twisted out of shape; misleading or misrepresented
vocabulary.example: The news media often presents a distorted view of reality.

vocabulary.definition: without thinking or caring about the consequences of an action
vocabulary.example: His reckless driving led to a serious accident.

vocabulary.definition: of only average quality; not very good
vocabulary.example: She received a mediocre grade on her exam.

vocabulary.definition: a person who presents stories in a way that is intended to provoke public interest or excitement, often at the expense of accuracy
vocabulary.example: The tabloid newspaper was criticized for its sensationalist headlines.

vocabulary.definition: a visual image such as a chart or diagram used to represent information or data
vocabulary.example: The infographic displayed statistics in an easy-to-understand format.
